intro: Cota hamzaoglui, commonly known as the Hamzaoglu's cota, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in complex umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
